result.execSummary:
The defendant Norman L Hegman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for State Farm Bank, to be paid joint and several as a condition of probation. To be paid before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

No Contact with the victim or co-defendant listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Norman L Hegman in court with Attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #4:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 2 days)   *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #5**
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS           **Transfer allowed to Sheboygan County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:victim or Co-Defendant listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $800.00 to State Farm Bank (joint and several) (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.


COUNT #5:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 2 days)   *CONCURRENT WITH COUNT #4**
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS           **Transfer allowed to Sheboygan County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with:victim or Co-Defendant listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Character letters filed by Atty Huppertz.
Sentencing hearing on April 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Norman L Hegman in court with Attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to counts #4 and 5.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #4 and 5.  Count #6 is dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Huppertz requests a sentencing date. Court addresses Defendant's warrant on a small claims case - Case #04SC2473.  Defendant signs financial disclosure statement and Judge cancels that warrant.   Court sets sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
